definitions.definition: The amount of money levied for a service .
examples: There will be a charge of five dollars.

definitions.definition: An attack in which combatants rush towards an enemy in an attempt to engage in close combat.
examples: Pickett's Charge ; the Charge of the Light Brigade

definitions.definition: A forceful forward movement .
An accusation .

subdefinitions.definition: An official description (by the police or a court) of a crime that somebody may be guilty of.
An accusation by a person or organization.
examples: That's a slanderous charge of abuse of trust.

definitions.definition: An electric charge .
The scope of someone's responsibility .
examples: The child was in the nanny's charge .

definitions.definition: Someone or something entrusted to one's care, such as a child to a babysitter or a student to a teacher.
examples: The child was a charge of the nanny.

definitions.definition: A load or burden ; cargo .
examples: The ship had a charge of colonists and their belongings.

definitions.definition: An instruction .
examples: I gave him the charge to get the deal closed by the end of the month.

definitions.definition: A mortgage .
An offensive foul in which the player with the ball moves into a stationary defender.
A measured amount of powder and/or shot in a cartridge .
A measured amount of explosive .
An image displayed on an escutcheon .
A position (of a weapon) fitted for attack.
examples: to bring a weapon to the charge

definitions.definition: A sort of plaster or ointment.
Weight; import; value.
A measure of thirty-six pigs of lead , each pig weighing about seventy pounds; a charre .
An address given at a church service concluding a visitation .
Cannabis .

main_definition: The amount of money levied for a service .
secondary_definitions: ( military ) An attack in which combatants rush towards an enemy in an attempt to engage in close combat.
( electromagnetism , chemistry , physics , countable , uncountable ) An electric charge .
Someone or something entrusted to one's care, such as a child to a babysitter or a student to a teacher.
( basketball ) An offensive foul in which the player with the ball moves into a stationary defender.
( firearms ) A measured amount of powder and/or shot in a cartridge .
( by extension ) A measured amount of explosive .
( heraldry ) An image displayed on an escutcheon .
( weaponry ) A position (of a weapon) fitted for attack.
( farriery ) A sort of plaster or ointment.
( historical or obsolete ) A measure of thirty-six pigs of lead , each pig weighing about seventy pounds; a charre .
( ecclesiastical ) An address given at a church service concluding a visitation .
